units.title: Colon tissue slicing and washing
units.text: For organoid generation, colon tissue was first sliced open lengthwise and wiped 3–4 times with gauze (Fisher Scientific) to remove waste and mucus. The tissue was then cut into small sections of ~2” × 2” and placed into a 15 cm dish filled with PBS++ (PBS supplemented with 10 mM HEPES (Thermo Fisher Scientific), 1X GlutaMAX (Thermo Fisher Scientific), 1X Pen-Strep (Thermo Fisher Scientific), and 2.5 μg/mL Amphotericin B (Thermo Fisher Scientific)).
units.rationale: Describes the initial preparation of colon tissue before crypt isolation.

units.title: Minced epithelium washing and centrifugation
units.text: Minced epithelium was washed 3 times with DMEM++ (Advanced DMEM/F12 (Thermo Fisher Scientific) supplemented with 10 mM HEPES, 1X GlutaMAX, 1X Pen-Strep, and 2.5 μg/mL Amphotericin B), and centrifuged at 500 × g for 3 min at 4 °C.
units.rationale: Details the cleaning and pelleting step for the minced epithelial fragments.

units.title: EDTA digestion to release crypts
units.text: Resuspended in 25 mL of 2.5 mM EDTA in PBS and placed in an end-over-end rotator at 37 °C until crypts were visible, around 12 min.
units.rationale: Specifies the enzymatic digestion conditions that liberate intestinal crypts.

units.title: Embedding crypts in Matrigel droplets
units.text: Crypts were plated in Matrigel (Corning) droplets, at a density of 30–50 crypts per droplet. Once Matrigel had solidified for 30 min at 37 °C, crypts were fed with organoid growth media.
units.rationale: Outlines how isolated crypts are embedded for 3‑D culture.

units.title: Organoid growth media formulation
units.text: Advanced DMEM/F12 supplemented with 1X Pen-Strep, 10 mM HEPES, 1X GlutaMAX, 1X B-27 Supplement, 0.2 nM Wnt Surrogate protein, 5 nM Gastrin-1, 1.25mM N-Acetyl-L-Cysteine, 10 mM Nicotinamide, 100 µg/mL Primocin, 500 nM A 83-01, 50 ng/mL recombinant human EGF, 100 ng/mL recombinant human Noggin, 250 ng/mL recombinant human R-spondin 3, 100 ng/mL recombinant human IGF1, 50 ng/mL recombinant human FGF2, and 10 µM Y-27632.
units.rationale: Provides the complete composition of the medium used to support organoid growth.

units.title: Gamma‑irradiation injury protocol
units.text: The plates were placed on the center of the rotating table of the (137Cs) gamma irradiator) for the time periods equivalent to either 6 Gy or 12 Gy, and then the organoids were further cultured in the incubator.
units.rationale: Describes the irradiation exposure used to model injury.

units.title: DSS treatment of organoids
units.text: For DSS treatment, DSS (MP Biomedicals) was dissolved in organoid media (without EGF or Nicotinamide), and added to organoid wells overnight for 16 h, after which organoids were washed twice with Advanced DMEM/F12 and then replaced with organoid media.
units.rationale: Details the chemical injury (DSS) application and subsequent washing steps.

units.title: Cytomix cytokine treatment
units.text: For cytomix treatment, human recombinant TNFɑ (R&D Systems), IFNγ (R&D systems), and IL-1β (PeproTech) were dissolved in organoid media.
units.rationale: Specifies the preparation of a cytokine cocktail used to simulate inflammatory signaling.

units.title: Organoid passaging protocol
units.text: To passage, organoids were mechanically dislodged from Cultrex domes using a P1000 pipette tip and resuspended in cold 10 mM EDTA with 10 µM Y-27632 (STEMCELL Technologies) in a 15 mL conical tube. The tube containing organoids was then placed on an end-over-end rotator at 4 °C for 30 min and then centrifuged for 5 min at 500 ×g, 4 °C. Organoids were then resuspended in 1X Trypsin (Fisher Scientific) and placed in an end-over-end rotator for 6 min at 37 °C.
units.rationale: Outlines the mechanical and enzymatic steps for sub‑culturing organoids.

units.title: FITC‑dextran permeability assay
units.text: FITC-Dextran (MedChemExpress) diluted to 2 mg/mL in PBS for 5 min in the incubator (37 °C, 5% CO2) for 30 min, after which organoid growth media with 10 µM Y-27632 was added. Media was changed every other day to organoid growth media. Organoids were then imaged on a Nikon spinning disc confocal to collect fluorescence and DIC images, and the percentage of intact organoids was calculated as the number of organoids per condition/donor that excluded FITC-dextran from the lumen divided by the total number of organoids.
units.rationale: Provides the steps for assessing barrier integrity of organoids using a fluorescent tracer.
